Description: Pottery ostracon: section of the foot-ring and flaring base of a coarse red ware pottery bowl, subsequently re-used as an ostracon. The fabric has a grey core, with faint traces of seven lines of black-painted hieratic text on the interior and a further four lines on the exterior, recording an account or legal case with reference to fields and supplies for a mother and father, and mentioning the pure-priest Tjuri and a woman Senetnefer.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389952) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389952)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
